title: Climate Zone Reference Sheet
description: Defines the climate zones present on the planet, using the Koppen classification as a foundation. Each zone specifies latitude range, temperature, precipitation, vegetation, and which species are found there. This is a reference document used throughout world creation.

id.description: Unique identifier for this reference sheet (auto-generated)

planet_id.description: The planet this climate reference applies to

latitude_range.description: Approximate latitude range where this zone occurs

pattern.description: When rain falls (year-round, seasonal, monsoon, dry)

vegetation.description: Typical vegetation (dense forest, savannah, grassland, scrub, tundra, etc.)

terrain_types.description: Terrain types commonly found in this zone

species_found.description: Species that inhabit or prefer this climate zone

storytelling_notes.description: How this climate affects story: travel difficulty, clothing, shelter needs, combat conditions

zones.description: All climate zones present on the planet

rain_shadow_notes.description: General notes on how rain shadows from mountain ranges modify climate zones

ocean_current_effects.description: How ocean currents modify expected climate zones (warm eastern coasts, cold western coasts, etc.)

altitude_effects.description: How altitude changes climate regardless of latitude

x-cross-references.planet-profile: Climate zones are determined by the planet's properties
x-cross-references.continent-profile: Continents contain these climate zones based on their latitude
x-cross-references.land-feature-catalog: Land features like mountains modify climate zones via rain shadows
x-cross-references.species-profile: Species habitats are defined by climate zones
x-cross-references.settlement-profile: Settlement climate depends on which zone it falls in
